author: Ron Wilkinson
content: I love rope work and rigging. I could spend more than a day in his little museum looking at the tools and trying to figure out how the knot work was done.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content:
If you are able to visit the Chatham Historic Dockyard do visit the rope-walk and see and maybe partake in making some rope. Its a wonderful experience for both adults and kids.
There is also a wonderful ships bookshop run by volunteers of a historical society full of obscure second-hand books.

author: DAVID RYE
content:
The contents of the Museum are being moved to Chatham dockyard.
See – https://thedockyard.co.uk/new-collection-at-the-dockyard/

author: Ginny
content: Thank you SO much for including this — it is fascinating and the arts and skills of the sailor are fabulous. Utilitarian, beautiful, time consuming, traditional and all the rest.
